00024 #ifndef _NIF_NODE_H_
00025 #define _NIF_NODE_H_
00026 
00027 #include "controlled.hpp"
00028 #include "data.hpp"
00029 
00030 namespace Nif
00031 {
00032 
00037 class Node : public Named
00038 {
00039 public:
00040   // Node flags. Interpretation depends somewhat on the type of node.
00041   int flags;
00042   const Transformation *trafo;
00043   PropertyList props;
00044 
00045   // Bounding box info
00046   bool hasBounds;
00047   const Vector *boundPos;
00048   const Matrix *boundRot;
00049   const Vector *boundXYZ; // Box size
00050 
00051   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00052   {
00053     Named::read(nif);
00054 
00055     flags = nif->getShort();
00056     trafo = nif->getTrafo();
00057     props.read(nif);
00058 
00059     hasBounds = !!nif->getInt();
00060     if(hasBounds)
00061       {
00062         nif->getInt(); // always 1
00063         boundPos = nif->getVector();
00064         boundRot = nif->getMatrix();
00065         boundXYZ = nif->getVector();
00066       }
00067 
00068     boneTrafo = NULL;
00069     boneIndex = -1;
00070   }
00071 
00072   // Bone transformation. If set, node is a part of a skeleton.
00073   const NiSkinData::BoneTrafo *boneTrafo;
00074 
00075   // Bone weight info, from NiSkinData
00076   const NiSkinData::BoneInfo *boneInfo;
00077 
00078   // Bone index. If -1, this node is either not a bone, or if
00079   // boneTrafo is set it is the root bone in the skeleton.
00080   short boneIndex;
00081 
00082   void makeRootBone(const NiSkinData::BoneTrafo *tr)
00083   {
00084     boneTrafo = tr;
00085     boneIndex = -1;
00086   }
00087 
00088   void makeBone(short ind, const NiSkinData::BoneInfo &bi)
00089   {
00090     boneInfo = &bi;
00091     boneTrafo = bi.trafo;
00092     boneIndex = ind;
00093   }
00094 };
00095 
00096 struct NiNode : Node
00097 {
00098   NodeList children;
00099   NodeList effects;
00100 
00101   /* Known NiNode flags:
00102 
00103      0x01 hidden
00104      0x02 use mesh for collision
00105      0x04 use bounding box for collision (?)
00106      0x08 unknown, but common
00107      0x20, 0x40, 0x80 unknown
00108    */
00109 
00110   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00111   {
00112     Node::read(nif);
00113     children.read(nif);
00114     effects.read(nif);
00115   }
00116 };
00117 
00118 struct NiTriShape : Node
00119 {
00120   /* Possible flags:
00121      0x40 - mesh has no vertex normals ?
00122 
00123      Only flags included in 0x47 (ie. 0x01, 0x02, 0x04 and 0x40) have
00124      been observed so far.
00125    */
00126 
00127   NiTriShapeDataPtr data;
00128   NiSkinInstancePtr skin;
00129 
00130   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00131   {
00132     Node::read(nif);
00133     data.read(nif);
00134     skin.read(nif);
00135   }
00136 };
00137 
00138 struct NiCamera : Node
00139 {
00140   struct Camera
00141   {
00142     // Camera frustrum
00143     float left, right, top, bottom, nearDist, farDist;
00144 
00145     // Viewport
00146     float vleft, vright, vtop, vbottom;
00147 
00148     // Level of detail modifier
00149     float LOD;
00150   };
00151 
00152   const Camera *cam;
00153 
00154   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00155   {
00156     Node::read(nif);
00157 
00158     nif->getPtr<Camera>();
00159 
00160     nif->getInt(); // -1
00161     nif->getInt(); // 0
00162   }
00163 };
00164 
00165 struct NiAutoNormalParticles : Node
00166 {
00167   NiAutoNormalParticlesDataPtr data;
00168 
00169   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00170   {
00171     Node::read(nif);
00172     data.read(nif);
00173     nif->getInt(); // -1
00174   }
00175 };
00176 
00177 struct NiRotatingParticles : Node
00178 {
00179   NiRotatingParticlesDataPtr data;
00180 
00181   void read(NIFFile *nif)
00182   {
00183     Node::read(nif);
00184     data.read(nif);
00185     nif->getInt(); // -1
00186   }
00187 };
